sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_military.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as a military aircraft, 0 if it is not.

sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_cargo.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as a cargo aircraft, 0 if it is not.

sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_glider.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as a glider, 0 if it is not.

sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_seaplane.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as a seaplane, 0 if it is not.

sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_helicopter.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as a helicopter, 0 if it is not.

sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_vtol.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as a VTOL, 0 if it is not.

sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_sci_fi.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as a science fiction aircraft, 0 if it is not.

sim/aircraft2/body/kill_body.description: if 1, X-Plane treats the body as having been removed from the aircraft for physics.

sim/aircraft2/engine/low_idle_ratio.description: The idle ratio for the engines at low idle.  1.0 provides default behavior; this can be any number greater than zero.

sim/aircraft2/engine/high_idle_ratio.description: The idle ratio for the engines at high idle. 1.0 provides default behavior; this can be any number greater than zero.

sim/aircraft2/engine/engine_friction_rat.description: The drag ratio for an engine's own internal friction and pumping losses. 1.0 for a recip engine provides default behavior of a Continental IO-550; this can be any number greater than zero.

sim/aircraft2/engine/max_power_limited_w.description: The maximum power output of the engine at sea level.  Note that if the engine has a waste gate this is the same as max power at critical altitude.

sim/aircraft2/engine/flap_extension_time.description: Time for flaps to go from full retraction to full extension

sim/aircraft2/engine/flap_retraction_tim.description: Time for flaps to go from full extension to full retraction

sim/aircraft2/engine/exhaust_dirtiness_r.description: dirtiness of built-in exhaust effects, 1.0 is default, positive numbers are more dirty

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/master_caution.description: This goes off any time there is a major problem with the bird: like it is on fire or something    // array of annunciators... kept as array for UDP IO

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/master_warning.description: This goes off whenever there is some more moderate problem with the bird... maybe lo fuel pressure ot qty

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/master_accept.description: Hit this button to CLEAR the master caution and warning: it says that you hear the buzzer and to shut it up already

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/autopilot_disc.description: This goes off for a few moments when the autopilot disconnects.. you wanna KNOW if otto just quit on you!

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/low_vacuum.description: The vacuum pressure, which drives the instruments in the old prop planes, is low: the artificial horizon may loose it is orientation!

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/low_voltage.description: The voltage os too high or low on one of the electrical buses

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/fuel_quantity.description: Fuel qty. no points for guessing if it is too high or too low to trigger this one

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/hydraulic_pres.description: Hydraulic pressure. should indicate if press is lo or hi

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/speedbrake.description: Speedbrake deployed: good to know so you do not forget it..

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/GPWS.description: Ground proximity warning system: PULL UP! PULL UP! my lancair does this during my typical red-baron approaches!

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/ice.description: Ice detected on the plane.. most people agree this is NOT a good thing.

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/low_rotor.description: Rotor rpm on the helo has dropped below normal operating: power availability will be reduced!

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/high_rotor.description: Rotor rpm on the helo has exceeded normal operating: power availability will be reduced, and god knows if the blades will stay ON!

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/pitot_heat.description: Pitot heat is OFF (YUP! OFF!) turn it on to heat up the pitot tube, which measures air pressure to give you air speed.

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/transonic.description: You are about to break the speed of sound when accelerating, or drop below the speed of sound if decelerating! the handling of the plane will change!

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/beta.description: Propeller in beta mode - per engine, double as NTS test light in fixed turboprops

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/N1_low.description: N1 of engine is too low for AC - per engine

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/battery_charge.description: Battery is charging too rapidly - may overheat

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/landing_taxi_l.description: Landing or taxiway light on but gear up

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/autopilot_bank.description: Autopilot bank limit is turned ON, autopilot will keep bank below 12.5 degrees of bank

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/fuel_pressure.description: Fuel pressure is lo, or maybe hi, for this engine    // x8

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/oil_pressure.description: Oil pressure is lo, or maybe hi, for this engine    // x8

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/oil_temperatur.description: Oil temperature hi for this engine    // x8

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/generator.description: The generator has failed! the plane cannot charge up. this may happen at lo rpm and go away as the engine revs. happens with my plane    // x8

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/chip_detect.description: We detected chips of metal in the engine somewhere. Most people agree this is not good.    // x8

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/engine_fire.description: The engine is on FIRE! this adds to excitement    // x8

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/inverter.description: The inverter has failed! the plane cannot convert ac from the generators to dc for the instruments.     // x2

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/stall_warning.description: Stall warning going off, yes or no.

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/stall_warning_.description: For aircraft with variable stall warnings, 0 = no stall, 1 = full stall

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/gear_warning.description: Gear warning going off, yes or no.

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/gear_warning_a.description: Gear aural warning going off, yes or no.

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/no_smoking.description: No smoking alert on, yes or no.

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/fasten_seatbel.description: Seatbelt sign on, yes or no.

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/windshear_warn.description: True if there's a windshear warning active

sim/cockpit2/annunciators/plugin_master_.description: Writeable without override. Write 1 to trigger master warning.
Writeable without override. Write 1 to trigger master caution.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/autopilot2_avail.description: Autopilot sources are hardwired to respective side, and two autopilots are available

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/master_flight_dir.description: If aputopilot2_avail is true, this selects the master FD: 0 = pilot, 1 = copilot, 2 = both independent

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/flight_director_c.description: Pilot side flight director command bars off/on. On always turns FD on, but off only turns FD off if it is not driving the autopilot, otherwise it just hides the bars
Co-Pilot side flight director command bars off/on. On always turns FD on, but off only turns FD off if it is not driving the autopilot, otherwise it just hides the bars

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/flight_director_m.description: Pilot side flight director is on and is the master for its autopilot
Co-Pilot side flight director is on and is the master for its autopilot

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/autopilot_electri.description: Electrical master switch to turn off all power supply to the autopilot

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/autopilot_source.description: Autopilot source system, pilots (0) or copilots (1). With two indipendent autopilots, selects the one that is flying.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/autothrottle_enab.description: Auto-throttle: -1=hard off, not even armed. 0=servos declutched (arm, hold), 1=airspeed hold, 2=N1 target hold, 3=retard, 4=reserved for future use

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/autothrottle_on.description: Auto-throttle really working?  Takes into account failures, esys, etc.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/autothrottle_arm.description: Auto-throttle armed and ready to move throttles? This is always 1 unless you use the autothrottle hard off command to completely dis-arm the system

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/electric_trim_on.description: Electric pitch trim on - if off, autopilot flies with pitch servo only, and can't trim!

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/otto_ready.description: whether the autopilot is ready, but not actually turned on. This is true when the autopilot has powered, has no failures, and is ready to be engaged but not engaged yet.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/heading_mode.description: Autopilot lateral mode. (0=roll, 1=heading sel, 2=nav, 10=TO/GA, 11=Re-entry, 12=Free, 13=GPSS, 14=heading hold, 15=turn-rate, 16=rollout, 18=track) Writeable with override only (sim/operation/override/override_autopilot)

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/altitude_mode.description: Autopilot vertical mode. (3=pitch, 4=vertical speed, 5=level change, 6=altitude hold, 7=terrain follow, 8=glideslope, 9=VNAV path, 10=TO/GA, 11=Re-Entry, 12=Free, 17=Flare, 19=flight path angle, 20=VNAV speed) Writeable with override only (sim/operation/override/override_autopilot)

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/bank_angle_mode.description: Maximum bank angle mode, 0->6. Higher number is steeper allowable bank.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/flight_director_m.description: Flight director mode, 0 is off, 1 is on, 2 is on with autopilot servos.  Good for the FD swich.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/flight_director2_.description: Flight director 2 mode, 0 is off, 1 is on, 2 is on with autopilot servos.  Good for the FD swich.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/flight_director3_.description: Autopilot 3 mode, 0 is off, 1 has no meaning, 2 is on with autopilot servos.  Good for the AP swich.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/autopilot_has_pow.description: Is the autopilot computer powered? Takes into account the master AP computer power switch, buses, failures.  AP can be powered even when it's not using the servos, etc.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/autopilot_on.description: Is the autopilot really on? Takes into account electrical system, failures, etc.;

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/autopilot2_on.description: Is the autopilot 2 really on? Takes into account electrical system, failures, etc.;

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/autopilot3_on.description: Is the autopilot 3 really on? Takes into account electrical system, failures, etc.;

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/autopilot_on_or_c.description: Is the autopilot really on? Like servos_on, but stays on even the servos are temporarily off for CWS.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/autopilot2_on_or_.description: Is the autopilot 2 really on? Like servos_on, but stays on even the servos are temporarily off for CWS.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/autopilot3_on_or_.description: Is the autopilot 2 really on? Like servos_on, but stays on even the servos are temporarily off for CWS.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/servos_on.description: Are the servos on?  Takes into account FD mode and control-wheel-steering, failures, etc.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/servos2_on.description: Are the servos on?  Takes into account FD2 mode and control-wheel-steering, failures, etc.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/servos3_on.description: Are the servos on?  Takes into account AP3 mode and control-wheel-steering, failures, etc.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/airspeed_is_mach.description: Autopilot airspeed is Mach number rather than knots.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/alt_vvi_is_showin.description: Is the combined alt/vvi selector showing VVI?

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/vnav_armed.description: Vnav is armed, 0 or 1 - this is different from the "FMS" button - it is used ONLY for a geometric VNAV descent. Can be used in planes with no auto-throttle.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/airspeed_dial_kts.description: Airspeed hold value, knots or Mach depending on km_is_mach.
Airspeed hold bug, always in knots, even if the AP is in mach-hold mode.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/heading_dial_deg_.description: Heading hold commanded, in degrees magnetic.
Heading hold commanded, in degrees magnetic.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/heading_is_gpss.description: 0 = Heading bug supplies HDG to autopilot, 1 = GPSS supplies heading to autopilot

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/altitude_dial_ft.description: Altitude selected for altitude-arm in feet indicated.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/altitude_hold_ft.description: Altitude hold commanded in feet indicated.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/altitude_vnav_ft.description: Target altitude hold in VNAV mode.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/barometer_setting.description: baro setting of the altitude preselector

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/altitude_readout_.description: current barometric altitude sensed by the altitude preselector

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/climb_adjust.description: climb mode adjust base speed knots (by default 150KIAS below 10.000ft)

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/des_adjust.description: descent mode adjust target vertical speed (by default -1500ft/min)

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/set_roll_deg.description: Roll-hold command in degrees right, turn knob that won't turn with other modes

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/turn_rate_deg_sec.description: Turn rate commanded in degrees per second, positive right

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/flight_director_p.description: Flight director pitch deflection in degrees, pos up.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/flight_director_r.description: Flight director roll deflection in degrees, pos right.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/flight_director2_.description: Flight director 2 pitch deflection in degrees, pos up.
Flight director 2 roll deflection in degrees, pos right.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/TOGA_pitch_deg.description: Nose-up pitch to hold when TOGA operations are in effect.  Set this back when your aircraft unloads!

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/attitude_status.description: Autopilot attitude hold (pitch and bank hold) status: 0=Off, 2=Captured

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/vnav_status.description: Autopilot VNAV status. 0=off,1=armed,2=captured - for geometric VNAV descent only - not to be confused with fms_vnav

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/fms_vnav.description: Enables the FMS to take over vertical control of the autopilot both pitch and throttle.   This matches the command "sim/autopilot/FMS"."

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/dead_reckoning.description: Whether the autopilot is using dead-reckoning to fly over a VOR station

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/alt_hold_is_alt_s.description: 0=Alt hold was pressed and locked into the current altitude. 1=Alt hold locked into an altitude that was pre-selected.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/alts_armed.description: In VNAV climb or descent, the upcoming altitude capture is mandated by the MCP altitude rather than a constraint.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/altv_armed.description: In VNAV climb or descent, the upcoming altitude capture is mandated by a constraint rather than the MCP altitude.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/alts_captured.description: VNAV levelled off in response to a MCP altitude

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/altv_captured.description: VNAV levelled off in response to an altitude constraint.

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/vnav_speed_window.description: VNAV speed window is open for pilot selection. Not writeable - use the spd_intv command if you want to open or close the speed window!

sim/cockpit2/autopilot/ap_ref_waiting.description: A/P REF annunciator, waiting for ref button to be pushed to lock into autopilot mode.

sim/cockpit2/camera/camera_offset_pitch.description: In-cockpit camera angular offset relative to airplane orientation (Pitch)

sim/cockpit2/camera/camera_offset_headin.description: In-cockpit camera angular offset relative to airplane orientation (Heading)

sim/cockpit2/camera/camera_offset_roll.description: In-cockpit camera angular offset relative to airplane orientation (Roll)

sim/cockpit2/camera/camera_offset_X.description: In-cockpit camera linear offset relative to airplane position

sim/cockpit2/camera/camera_offset_Y.description: In-cockpit camera linear offset relative to airplane position

sim/cockpit2/camera/camera_offset_Z.description: In-cockpit camera linear offset relative to airplane position

sim/cockpit2/clock_timer/elapsed_time_ho.description: Elapsed time on the timer, hours

sim/cockpit2/clock_timer/elapsed_time_mi.description: Elapsed time on the timer, minutes

sim/cockpit2/clock_timer/elapsed_time_se.description: Elapsed time on the timer, seconds

sim/cockpit2/clock_timer/timer_is_GMT.description: True if time shown is GMT

sim/cockpit2/clock_timer/date_is_showing.description: True if date is showing (date button pressed recently)

sim/cockpit2/controls/yoke_pitch_ratio.description: How much the user input has deflected the yoke in the cockpit, in ratio, where -1.0 is full down, and 1.0 is full up.

sim/cockpit2/controls/yoke_roll_ratio.description: How much the user input has deflected the yoke in the cockpit, in ratio, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.

sim/cockpit2/controls/yoke_heading_ratio.description: How much the user input has deflected the rudder in the cockpit, in ratio, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.

sim/cockpit2/controls/yoke_pitch_ratio_c.description: How much the copilot user input has deflected the yoke in the cockpit, in ratio, where -1.0 is full down, and 1.0 is full up.

sim/cockpit2/controls/yoke_roll_ratio_co.description: How much the copilot user input has deflected the yoke in the cockpit, in ratio, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.

sim/cockpit2/controls/yoke_heading_ratio.description: How much the copilot user input has deflected the rudder in the cockpit, in ratio, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.

sim/cockpit2/controls/total_heading_rati.description: Total rudder control input (sum of user pedal plus autopilot servo plus artificial stability)

sim/cockpit2/controls/total_pitch_ratio.description: Total pitch control input (sum of user yoke plus autopilot servo plus artificial stability)

sim/cockpit2/controls/total_roll_ratio.description: Total roll control input (sum of user yoke plus autopilot servo plus artificial stability)

sim/cockpit2/controls/total_pitch_ratio_.description: Total pitch control input copilot side (sum of user yoke plus autopilot servo plus artificial stability)

sim/cockpit2/controls/total_roll_ratio_c.description: Total roll control input copilot side(sum of user yoke plus autopilot servo plus artificial stability)

sim/cockpit2/controls/torque_tube_split_.description: 0 = Normal: Left and right roll input are connected, 1 = Disconnected, each joystick roll input for pilot or copilot goes to the respective side.
0 = Normal: Left and right pitch input are connected, 1 = Disconnected, each joystick pitch input for pilot or copilot goes to the respective side.

sim/cockpit2/controls/roll_spoiler_actua.description: 0 = Normal: left roll spoiler is controlled by left roll input, right roll spoiler is controlled by right roll input. 1 = Left: Both roll spoilers are controlled by the left aileron. 2 = Right: Both roll spoilers are controlled by the right aileron.

sim/cockpit2/controls/speedbrake_ratio.description: How much the speebrake HANDLE is deflected, in ratio, where 0.0 is fully retracted, 0.5 is halfway down, and 1.0 is fully down, and -0.5 is speedbrakes ARMED.

sim/cockpit2/controls/wingsweep_ratio.description: Requested sweep, in ratio. 0.0 is no sweep requested, 1 is max sweep requested.

sim/cockpit2/controls/thrust_vector_rati.description: Requested thrust vector, in ratio. 0.0 is no thrust vector requested, 1 is max thrust vector requested.

sim/cockpit2/controls/dihedral_ratio.description: Requested dihedral, in ratio. 0.0 is no dihedral requested, 1 is max dihedral requested.

sim/cockpit2/controls/incidence_ratio.description: Requested incidence, in ratio. 0.0 is no incidence requested, 1 is max incidence requested.

sim/cockpit2/controls/wing_retraction_ra.description: Requested wing-retraction, in ratio. 0.0 is no wing-retraction requested, 1 is max wing-retraction requested.

sim/cockpit2/controls/flap_system_deploy.description: The ACTUAL FLAP deployment for overall flap system, in ratio, where 0.0 is flaps fully retracted, and 1.0 is flaps fully extended. Use the deployment for flap set 1 or flap set 2 to deflect the surfaces though. This takes into account that flaps deploy slowly, not instantaneously as the handle is dragged.

sim/cockpit2/controls/flap_handle_reques.description: The flap HANDLE location, in ratio, where 0.0 is handle fully retracted, and 1.0 is handle fully extended.

sim/cockpit2/controls/parking_brake_rati.description: The overall brake requested by the parking brake button... 0.0 is none, 1.0 is complete.

sim/cockpit2/controls/left_brake_ratio.description: Additional left brake requested by pedal deflection, 0.0 to 1.0.

sim/cockpit2/controls/right_brake_ratio.description: Additional right brake requested by pedal deflection, 0.0 to 1.0.

sim/cockpit2/controls/gear_handle_down.description: Gear handle position. 0 is up. 1 is down.

sim/cockpit2/controls/gear_handle_animat.description: Gear handle position as float for lever animation. 0 is up, 1 is down, 0.5 is off (for planes that have that).

sim/cockpit2/controls/gear_handle_reques.description: Gear handle request. 0 is up, 1 is down, -1 is off. Not writeable, use commands sim/flight_controls/landing_gear_[down/up/toggle/off]

sim/cockpit2/controls/gear_handle_downlo.description: Gear handle downlock release. If this is 1, the gear handle can be moved to up even if the squat switch reports weight on wheels

sim/cockpit2/controls/nosewheel_steer_on.description: Is the nosewheel steering turned on? 0 or 1.  This must be off AND the tail wheel must be unlocked to free castor.

sim/cockpit2/controls/brake_fan_on.description: Brake fan switch on for cooling the brakes down faster

sim/cockpit2/controls/tailwheel_lock_rat.description: Tail-wheel lockig ratio. 0 for free-castoring, 1 for totally locked.

sim/cockpit2/controls/aileron_trim.description: Aileron trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the aileron trim is deflected enough to move the ailerons through 30% of their travel, then that is an aileron trim of 0.3. -1=left 1=right

sim/cockpit2/controls/elevator_trim.description: Elevator trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the elevator trim is deflected enough to move the elevators through 30% of their travel, then that is an elevator trim of 0.3. -1=down 1=up

sim/cockpit2/controls/rudder_trim.description: Rudder trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the rudder trim is deflected enough to move the rudders through 30% of their travel, then that is an rudder trim of 0.3. -1=left 1=right

sim/cockpit2/controls/water_rudder_handl.description: Deployment of the water rudder, 0 is none, 1 is max

sim/cockpit2/controls/flap_handle_deploy.description: How far the indicator of flap deployment has moved in the cockpit.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/map_mode_is_HSI.description: Map is in HSI mode, 0 or 1.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/map_range.description: Map range, 1->6, where 6 is the longest range.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_weather_on.description: On the moving map, show the weather or not.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_terrain_on.description: On the moving map, show the terrain or not.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_tcas_on.description: On the moving map, show the TCAS or not.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_airport_on.description: On the moving map, show the airports or not.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_fix_on.description: On the moving map, show the fixes or not.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_vor_on.description: On the moving map, show the VORs or not.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_ndb_on.description: On the moving map, show the NDBs or not.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/map_mode_is_HSI_copilo.description: copilot Map is in HSI mode, 0 or 1.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/map_range_copilot.description: copilot Map range, 1->6, where 6 is the longest range.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/map_range_nm_copilot.description: Copilot Map range in nautical miles

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_weather_on_copilo.description: On the copilot moving map, show the weather or not.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_terrain_on_copilo.description: On the copilot moving map, show the terrain or not.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_tcas_on_copilot.description: On the copilot moving map, show the TCAS or not.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_airport_on_copilo.description: On the copilot moving map, show the airports or not.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_fix_on_copilot.description: On the copilot moving map, show the fixes or not.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_vor_on_copilot.description: On the copilot moving map, show the VORs or not.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_ndb_on_copilot.description: On the copilot moving map, show the NDBs or not.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_1_selection_pilot.description: EFIS waypoint 1 is showing: 0=ADF1, 1=OFF, 2=VOR1 or 3=FMS1 -- Pilot

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_1_selection_copil.description: EFIS waypoint 2 is showing: 0=ADF1, 1=OFF, 2=VOR1 or 3=FMS1 -- Copilot

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_2_selection_pilot.description: EFIS waypoint 1 is showing: 0=ADF2, 1=OFF, 2=VOR2 or 3=FMS2 -- Pilot

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_2_selection_copil.description: EFIS waypoint 2 is showing: 0=ADF2, 1=OFF, 2=VOR2 or 3=FMS2 -- Copilot

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/EFIS_page.description: An array of EFIS page switches for selecting which EFIS page is visible.

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/G1000_reversionary_mod.description: Does the G1000 display condensed PFD/MFD information for single-screen operation?

sim/cockpit2/EFIS/map_range_steps.description: Range steps 0..7 of the ND map. 0 entries if selector has less than 8 stops.

sim/cockpit2/electrical/inverter_on.description: Inverter turned on, 0 or 1. (Was 8, but should be 2 total.)

sim/cockpit2/electrical/battery_voltage_.description: Actual battery voltage in, umm, volts?
Indicated battery voltage in, umm, volts? ...The indication may be different than the actual voltage!

sim/cockpit2/electrical/APU_generator_on.description: APU generator is turned on, 0 or 1.

sim/cockpit2/electrical/APU_starter_swit.description: APU power switch, 0 is off, 1 is on, 2 is start-er-up!

sim/cockpit2/electrical/cross_tie.description: Switch to connect the two busses together - power from one feeds the other.  0 or 1.

sim/cockpit2/electrical/dc_voltmeter_sel.description: Volt-meter selection (0=external,1=ctr,2=lft,3=rgt,4=tpl,5=bat - use cmnds to set!

sim/cockpit2/electrical/bus_volts.description: Bus voltage for given bus - dim 4 until 1030

sim/cockpit2/electrical/bus_load_amps.description: Bus load in amps per bus - dim 4 until 1030

sim/cockpit2/electrical/plugin_bus_load_.description: Add additional load to this dataref to create additional custom bus loads.

sim/cockpit2/electrical/panel_brightness.description: Actual panel brightness, taking into account failures
Actual panel brightness, taking into account failures
Actual panel brightness, taking into account failures

sim/cockpit2/electrical/instrument_brigh.description: Actual instrument brightness, taking into account failures - was [16] until 11.10
Actual instrument brightness, taking into account failures - was [16] until 11.10
Actual instrument brightness, taking into account failures - was [16] until 11.10

sim/cockpit2/electrical/HUD_brightness_r.description: Actual HUD brightness, taking into account failures
Actual HUD brightness, taking into account failures

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/cyclic_ail.description: Lateral cyclic COMMAND, in degrees. Positive right cyclic.

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/throttle_r.description: Throttle position of the handle itself, from 0.0 (idle) to 1.0 (max normal).

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/throttle_b.description: Throttle position of the handle as a ratio with reverse and beta, -2..-1 = rev, -1..0=beta, 0..1=alpha

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/throttle_j.description: Throttle position of the handle as a ratio with reverse, -1..0 = rev, 0..1=fwd

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/beta_ratio.description: Throttle position of the handle as a ratio, 0.0 is minimum beta, 1.0 = maximum beta.

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/throttle_r.description: Throttle position of the handle itself - this controls all the handles at once.

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/throttle_b.description: Controls the throttle handle position, but includes beta and reverse.  -2..-1 is reverse, -1..0 is beta, 0..1 is alpha.

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/throttle_j.description: Controls the throttle handle position, but includes reverse.  -1..0 is reverse, 0..1 is fwd.

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/prop_rotat.description: Prop handle position, in radians per second of requested prop rpm.  Use this if your plane has a constant speed prop.
Prop handle position, this controls all props at once.

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/prop_angle.description: Prop handle position, in degrees.  Use this if your plane has a manual-adjust prop.
Prop handle position, in degrees, set all at once.

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/prop_ratio.description: Prop handle position, in ratio. NOTE: This is also used for helicopter collective!
Prop handle position, in ratio. This controls all handles at once. NOTE: This is also used for helicopter collective!

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/mixture_ra.description: Mixture handle position, this controls all at once.

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/eng_master.description: Engine Master switch ON/OFF for engines that require the mode selector

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/auto_ignit.description: Auto-igniter switch, 0 or 1. Auto-ignition. This switch turns on a continuous ignition source in the engine to automatically relight it if there is a flameout.

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/ignition_k.description: 0 = off, 1 = left, 2 = right, 3 = both, 4 = starting. The dataref is spring-loaded for starter. You have to keep setting it to start in order to keep cranking.

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/starter_hi.description: True while the starter motor is engaged

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/fuel_pump_.description: Fuel pump, on or off.  This is the electric per-engine fuel pump!

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/idle_speed.description: Idle speed, hi=1 or lo=0 - continuous control

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/prop_mode.description: Propeller and engine operation mode. It is used for props and jets. Mode 0 is feathered, 1 is normal, 2 is in beta, and reverse (prop or jet) is mode 3.

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/prop_pitch.description: REQUESTED pitch of the prop in degrees from its flat-pitch setting.

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/start_lock.description: Start lock to lock prop into fine pitch position so it doesn't feather on loss of oil pressure, for fixed turbofan engines.

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/unfeather_.description: Manual unfeather pump can provide oil pressure to the governor, to unfeather a stopped prop when the startlocks weren't engaged. Running the pump first unfeathers the prop and then engages the startlock

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/clutch_eng.description: XP10: the on/off status of the clutch, either per engine or per prop, depending on voodoo, dim 8. XP11: there is only ONE clutch for the whole airplane.

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/clutch_rat.description: XP10: the ratio of the clutch, either per engine or per prop, depending on voodoo, dim 8. XP11: there is only ONE clutch for the whole airplane.

sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/manual_fea.description: override and activate the feather, no matter what any auto-feather logic does.

sim/cockpit2/engine/indicators/fuel_flow.description: total fuel flow, kilograms per second.
dry fuel flow, kilograms per second.

sim/cockpit2/engine/indicators/ITT_deg_C.description: ITT, deg.  Dataref label is wrong, units vary by plane.

sim/cockpit2/engine/indicators/EGT_deg_C.description: EGT, deg.  Dataref label is wrong, units vary by plane.

sim/cockpit2/engine/indicators/CHT_deg_C.description: CHT, deg.  Dataref label is wrong, units vary by plane.

sim/cockpit2/engine/indicators/EGT_CYL_d.description: EGT, deg.  Dataref label is wrong, units vary by plane. Up to 12 cylinders

sim/cockpit2/engine/indicators/CHT_CYL_d.description: CHT, deg.  Dataref label is wrong, units vary by plane. Up to 12 cylinders

sim/cockpit2/engine/indicators/oil_tempe.description: Oil temp, deg.    Dataref label is wrong, units vary by plane.

sim/cockpit2/engine/indicators/igniter_s.description: Whether igniters are sparking, either because the pilot or system logic turned them on, power is available and they are not failed

sim/cockpit2/engine/indicators/igniter_v.description: Voltage we have to charge the ignition, useful for sound effects

sim/cockpit2/fuel/fuel_tank_pump_on.description: True if the pump for this tank is on.

sim/cockpit2/fuel/showing_aux.description: True if user is holding down the aux-tank button.

sim/cockpit2/fuel/fuel_totalizer_init_kg.description: Total fuel on board the fuel totalizer was initialized with

sim/cockpit2/fuel/fuel_totalizer_sum_kg.description: Total accumulated fuel used by all engines since totalizer initialization

sim/cockpit2/fuel/fuel_totalizer_sum_eng.description: Total accumulated fuel used by this engine N since totalizer initialization

sim/cockpit2/fuel/transfer_pump_left.description: Transfer from left AUXes to left FEEDers: 0: Off, 1: Auto, 2: On/Override

sim/cockpit2/fuel/transfer_pump_right.description: Transfer from right AUXes to right FEEDers: 0: Off, 1: Auto, 2: On/Override

sim/cockpit2/fuel/transfer_pump_activati.description: Automatically transfer from AUXes to FEEDers in auto mode when feeder has more than X kg left to full

sim/cockpit2/fuel/transfer_pump_deactiva.description: Automatically stop transferring from AUXes to FEEDers in auto mode when feeder has less than X kg left to full

sim/cockpit2/fuel/fuel_level_indicated_l.description: Indicated fuel level left, shows total or only nacelle tanks depending if user is holding down the aux-tank button.

sim/cockpit2/fuel/fuel_level_indicated_r.description: Indicated fuel level right, shows total or only nacelle tanks depending if user is holding down the aux-tank button.

sim/cockpit2/fuel/auto_crossfeed.description: 0=Off 1=Auto 2=On - If fuel pressure on one side is low, due to fuel pump failure for example, cross-feed is opened to allow one pump to supply pressure to both engines.

sim/cockpit2/fuel/no_transfer_left.description: Warning light, will illuminate when transfer from aux to feeder is requested, but aux tank is empty

sim/cockpit2/fuel/no_transfer_right.description: Warning light, will illuminate when transfer from aux to feeder is requested, but aux tank is empty

sim/cockpit2/fuel/transfer_test.description: Transfer test switch. 0 = normal, -1 = test left, +1 = test right

sim/cockpit2/fuel/tank_pump_pressure_psi.description: Pressure generated by the fuel pump per tank. If multiple tanks are accesible per the fuel selector, fuel will be consumed from the tanks in order of pump pressure

sim/cockpit2/gauges/actuators/barometer_.description: Barometric pressure setting, inches HG.  Pilot side.
Barometric pressure setting, inches HG.  Copilot side.
Barometric pressure setting, inches HG.  Standby instrument.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/actuators/radio_alti.description: Radio altitude bug entered into the radio altimeter. Pilot side.
Radio altitude bug entered into the radio altimeter. Copilot side.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/actuators/artificial.description: Artificial horizon pitch-reference adjustment. Pilot side.
Artificial horizon pitch-reference adjustment. Copilot side.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/slip_deg.description: Slip indication, in degrees of ball deflection from centered.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/compass_h.description: Indicated heading of the wet compass, in degrees.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/airspeed_.description: Indicated airspeed in knots, pilot. Writeable with override_IAS
Indicated airspeed in knots, copilot. Writeable with override_IAS
Indicated airspeed in knots, standby instrument. Writeable with override_IAS

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/calibrate.description: Calibrated airspeed in knots, standby instrument

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/altitude_.description: Indicated height, MSL, in feet, primary system, based on pilots barometric pressure input.
Indicated height, MSL, in feet, primary system, based on co-pilots barometric pressure input.
Indicated height, MSL, in feet, primary system, based on standby instrument barometric pressure input.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/vvi_fpm_p.description: Indicated vertical speed in feet per minute, pilot system.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/vvi_fpm_c.description: Indicated vertical speed in feet per minute, copilot system.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/turn_rate.description: Indicated rate-of-turn, in degrees deflection, for newer roll-augmented turn-indicators.  Pilot side.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/true_airs.description: True airspeed in knots, for pilot pitot/static, calculated by ADC, requires pitot, static, oat sensor and ADC all to work correctly to give correct value
True airspeed in knots, for copilot pitot/static, calculated by ADC, requires pitot, static, oat sensor and ADC all to work correctly to give correct value

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/ground_sp.description: Ground speed in knots, as measured by a GPS based on 2D position. So if you are going straight up or straight down at high speed, this is 0.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/turn_rate.description: Indicated rate-of-turn, in degrees deflection, for newer roll-augmented turn-indicators.  Copilot side.
Indicated rate-of-turn, in degrees deflection, for old-style turn-indicators.  Pilot side.
Indicated rate-of-turn, in degrees deflection, for old-style turn-indicators.  Copilot side.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/heading_A.description: Indicated magnetic heading, in degrees.  Source: AHARS.  Side: Pilot
Indicated magnetic heading, in degrees.  Source: AHARS.  Side: Copilot

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/heading_e.description: Indicated magnetic heading, in degrees.  Source: electric gyro.  Side: Pilot
Indicated magnetic heading, in degrees.  Source: electric gyro.  Side: Copilot

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/heading_v.description: Indicated magnetic heading, in degrees.  Source: vacuum gyro.  Side: Pilot
Indicated magnetic heading, in degrees.  Source: vacuum gyro.  Side: Copilot

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/pitch_AHA.description: Indicated pitch, in degrees, positive up.  Source: AHARS.  Side: Pilot
Indicated pitch, in degrees, positive up.  Source: AHARS.  Side: Copilot

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/pitch_ele.description: Indicated pitch, in degrees, positive up.  Source: electric gyro.  Side: Pilot
Indicated pitch, in degrees, positive up.  Source: electric gyro.  Side: Copilot

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/pitch_vac.description: Indicated pitch, in degrees, positive up.  Source: vacuum gyro.  Side: Pilot
Indicated pitch, in degrees, positive up.  Source: vacuum gyro.  Side: Copilot

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/radio_alt.description: Radio-altimeter indicated height in feet, pilot-side
Radio-altimeter indicated height in feet, copilot-side

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/baro_alti.description: Baro-altimeter altitude alert light, as per autopilot altitude warn configuration, pilot. 0 = off, 1 = lit, 2 = blinking
Baro-altimeter altitude alert light, as per autopilot altitude warn configuration, copilot. 0 = off, 1 = lit, 2 = blinking

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/AoA_pilot.description: indicated angle of attack, degrees, pilot side AoA vane

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/AoA_copil.description: indicated angle of attach, degress, co-pilot side AoA vane

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/roll_AHAR.description: Indicated roll, in degrees, positive right. Source: AHARS.  Side: Pilot
Indicated roll, in degrees, positive right. Source: AHARS.  Side: Copilot

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/roll_elec.description: Indicated roll, in degrees, positive right. Source: electric gyro.  Side: Pilot
Indicated roll, in degrees, positive right. Source: electric gyro.  Side: Copilot

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/roll_vacu.description: Indicated roll, in degrees, positive right. Source: vacuum gyro.  Side: Pilot
Indicated roll, in degrees, positive right. Source: vacuum gyro.  Side: Copilot

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/wind_head.description: Wind direction currently acting on the plane, in degrees magnetic.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/wind_spee.description: Wind speed currently acting on the plane, in knots true.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/suction_1.description: Vacuum system 1 suction as ratio of max available in plane.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/suction_2.description: Vacuum system 2 suction as ratio of max available in plane.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/water_rat.description: Ratio of releasable water still in the tank, 0..1.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/prop_sync.description: Degrees difference between two prop.  Can be used for prop sync display.

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/ground_tr.description: The ground track of the aircraft in degrees magnetic
The ground track of the aircraft in degrees magnetic

sim/cockpit2/gauges/indicators/max_mach_.description: For planes with a max mach number, this is the max mach number converted to KIAS for the current plane altitude, etc. - useful for adaptive needles and limit markers on tapes
For planes with a max mach number, this is the lesser of the max mach number converted to KIAS for the current plane altitude and V-never-exceed.

sim/cockpit2/hydraulics/actuators/ram_ai.description: ram air turbine (the rat) when total failure

sim/cockpit2/hydraulics/actuators/engine.description: engine-driven hydraulic pump, all systems on this engine

sim/cockpit2/hydraulics/actuators/prop_p.description: rotor-driven hydraulic pump, per prop index, not engine, all systems. This is found on helicopters, to keep hydraulic pressure up in auto-rotation
rotor-driven hydraulic pump, per prop index, not engine, system A. This is found on helicopters, to keep hydraulic pressure up in auto-rotation
rotor-driven hydraulic pump, per prop index, not engine, system B. This is found on helicopters, to keep hydraulic pressure up in auto-rotation
rotor-driven hydraulic pump, per prop index, not engine, system C. This is found on helicopters, to keep hydraulic pressure up in auto-rotation

sim/cockpit2/hydraulics/actuators/PTU.description: Status of power transfer unit: 0=Off, 1=Armed for pressure differential, 2=running right now

sim/cockpit2/hydraulics/indicators/hydra.description: Hydraulic system 1 pressure, units set by Plane-Maker.
Hydraulic system 2 pressure, units set by Plane-Maker.
Hydraulic system 3 pressure, units set by Plane-Maker.

sim/cockpit2/hydraulics/indicators/brake.description: Brake accumulator pressure, ratio 0..1 of fully charged.

sim/cockpit2/hydraulics/indicators/hydra.description: Hydraulic fluid quantity, ratio of max, system 1 (left)
Hydraulic fluid quantity, ratio of max, system 2 (right)
Hydraulic fluid quantity, ratio of max, system 3 (center)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_inlet_heat_on.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - inlet heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat in the engine air inlet keep ice from choking your engine. Engine 1 only

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_prop_heat_on.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - prop heat. This switch turns on de-icing of the propeller(s) to keep ice from building up on your prop. Engine 1 only

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_inlet_heat_on_per_e.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - inlet heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat in the engine air inlet keep ice from choking your engine.  Per engine

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_prop_heat_on_per_en.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - prop heat. This switch turns on de-icing of the propeller(s) to keep ice from building up on your prop.  Per engine

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_window_heat_on.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - windshield heat. This switch turns on windshield de-icing to keep ice from blocking your vision.

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_window_heat_on_wind.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - windshield heat. This switch turns on windshield de-icing to keep ice from blocking your vision.

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_pitot_heat_on_pilot.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - pitot tube heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat in the pitot tube. If it freezes up your airspeed indicator and altimeter stop working. Airspeed and altitude related autopilot functions are also affected.

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_pitot_heat_on_copil.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  Pitot tube heat, co-pilot. This switch turns on de-icing heat in the co-pilot side pitot tube. If it freezes up your airspeed indicator and altimeter stop working. Airspeed and altitude related autopilot functions are also affected.

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_pitot_heat_on_stand.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  Pitot tube heat, standby pitot. This switch turns on de-icing heat for the standby instruments pitot tube. If it freezes up your airspeed indicator and altimeter stop working. Airspeed and altitude related autopilot functions are also affected.

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_AOA_heat_on.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  AOA sensor heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat for the AOA sensor. If it freezes up your AOA indicator stops working. AOA sensor failure will also affect the aircraft's artificial stability system if it has one.  Pilot.

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_AOA_heat_on_copilot.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  AOA sensor heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat for the AOA sensor. If it freezes up your AOA indicator stops working. AOA sensor failure will also affect the aircraft's artificial stability system if it has one.  Copilot.

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_static_heat_on_pilo.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  Static port heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat for the static sensor. If it freezes up your altimeter, vvi and airspeed indicator stop working. Pilot.

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_static_heat_on_copi.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  Static port heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat for the static sensor. If it freezes up your altimeter, vvi and airspeed indicator stop working. Copilot.

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_static_heat_on_stan.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  Static port heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat for the static sensor. If it freezes up your altimeter, vvi and airspeed indicator stop working. Standby instruments.

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surfce_heat_on.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - electric heat. This switch engages electrically heated leading edges. (All wings)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surfce_heat_left_on.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - electric heat. This switch engages electrically heated leading edges. (Left wing)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surfce_heat_right_o.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - electric heat. This switch engages electrically heated leading edges. (Right wing)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_boot_on.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, 2, 3.  De-ice - pneumatic. This switch inflates flexible bladders on the wing leading edges to pop off accumulated ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Continuous, 2 = Single/Auto (deflates automatically), 3 = Man (deflates when switch let go) (All wings)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_boot_left_o.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, 2, 3.  De-ice - pneumatic. This switch inflates flexible bladders on the wing leading edges to pop off accumulated ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Continuous, 2 = Single/Auto (deflates automatically), 3 = Man (deflates when switch let go) (Left wing)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_boot_right_.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, 2, 3.  De-ice - pneumatic. This switch inflates flexible bladders on the wing leading edges to pop off accumulated ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Continuous, 2 = Single/Auto (deflates automatically), 3 = Man (deflates when switch let go) (Right wing)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_hot_bleed_a.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - bleed air. This switch directs warm air from the engines into the wing leading edges to keep them free of ice. (All wings)
De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - bleed air. This switch directs warm air from the engines into the wing leading edges to keep them free of ice. (Left wing)
De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - bleed air. This switch directs warm air from the engines into the wing leading edges to keep them free of ice. (Right wing)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_wing_hot_bleed_air_.description: Wing anti-ice bleed air is normally provided by the on-side engine (i.e. the left wing gets hot bleed air from the left engine's ductwork). By opening this valve, either engine can provide wing anti-ice by means of HP air, even if the LP isolation valve(s) are closed.

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_tks_on.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, or 2.  De-ice - TKS fluid. This switch activates the pump for the weeping wing, dissipating TKS fluid on the leading edges to keep them free of ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Norm, 2 = High. (All wings)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_tks_left_on.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, or 2.  De-ice - TKS fluid. This switch activates the pump for the weeping wing, dissipating TKS fluid on the leading edges to keep them free of ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Norm, 2 = High. (Left wing)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_tks_right_o.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, or 2.  De-ice - TKS fluid. This switch activates the pump for the weeping wing, dissipating TKS fluid on the leading edges to keep them free of ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Norm, 2 = High. (Right wing)

sim/cockpit2/ice/cowling_thermal_anti_ic.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - inlet heat. This switch turns on thermal anti ice of the engine cowling and inlet. This takes hot bleed air from the HP compressor.  Per engine

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_prop_tks_on_per_eng.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, or 2.  De-ice - prop TKS. This switch turns on de-icing of the propeller(s) with TKS fluid to keep ice from building up on your prop. 0 = Off, 1 = Norm, 2 = High. Per engine

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_wing_boots_inflatio.description: De-icing boots inflation ratio, left and right wing

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tailplane_man.description: De-ice tailplane automatically with wing/airframe deice, or separately with new datarefs. 0 = Auto, Default for all planes: Tail is deiced with whatever acts on the wings. 1 = Man: Tailplane de-ice is no longer slaved and must be turned on with separate datarefs.

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_heat_on.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - electric heat. This switch engages electrically heated leading edges. (All tailplanes)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_heat_left_on.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - electric heat. This switch engages electrically heated leading edges. (Left tailplanes)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_heat_right_on.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - electric heat. This switch engages electrically heated leading edges. (Right tailplanes)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_boot_on.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, 2, 3.  De-ice - pneumatic. This switch inflates flexible bladders on the wing leading edges to pop off accumulated ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Continuous, 2 = Single/Auto (deflates automatically), 3 = Man (deflates when switch let go) (All tailplanes)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_boot_left_on.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, 2, 3.  De-ice - pneumatic. This switch inflates flexible bladders on the wing leading edges to pop off accumulated ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Continuous, 2 = Single/Auto (deflates automatically), 3 = Man (deflates when switch let go) (Left tailplanes)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_boot_right_on.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, 2, 3.  De-ice - pneumatic. This switch inflates flexible bladders on the wing leading edges to pop off accumulated ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Continuous, 2 = Single/Auto (deflates automatically), 3 = Man (deflates when switch let go) (Right tailplanes)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_hot_bleed_air_.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - bleed air. This switch directs warm air from the engines into the tailplane leading edges to keep them free of ice. (All tailplanes)
De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - bleed air. This switch directs warm air from the engines into the tailplane leading edges to keep them free of ice. (Left tailplanes)
De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - bleed air. This switch directs warm air from the engines into the tailplane leading edges to keep them free of ice. (Right tailplanes)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_tks_on.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, or 2.  De-ice - TKS fluid. This switch activates the pump for the weeping wing, dissipating TKS fluid on the leading edges to keep them free of ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Norm, 2 = High. (All tailplanes)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_tks_left_on.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, or 2.  De-ice - TKS fluid. This switch activates the pump for the weeping wing, dissipating TKS fluid on the leading edges to keep them free of ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Norm, 2 = High. (Left tailplanes)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_tks_right_on.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, or 2.  De-ice - TKS fluid. This switch activates the pump for the weeping wing, dissipating TKS fluid on the leading edges to keep them free of ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Norm, 2 = High. (Right tailplanes)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_boots_inflatio.description: De-icing boots inflation ratio, left and right tailplane

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_auto_ignite_on.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - auto-ignition. This switch turns on a continuous ignition source in the engine to automatically relight it if there is a flameout.

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_detect_on.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  Ice-detection: Turn this switch on to enable ice-detection... if the system detects ice, it will light up the ICE annunciator.

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tks_fluid_liter.description: TKS de-icing fluid reserve. See sim/aircraft/specialcontrols/acf_tks_cap_liter for the plane's total capacity.

sim/cockpit2/ice/tks_backup_pump.description: Backup pump selected permanently on for TKS FIKI

sim/cockpit2/ice/tks_max_time_left.description: Timer for TKS FIKI max flow rate (counts down from 2 minutes)

sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_deice_holdover_time.description: Holdover time left in minutes until ground de-icing becomes ineffective.

sim/cockpit2/pressurization/actuators/du.description: Dump pressurization to the current altitude, 0 or 1.

sim/cockpit2/pressurization/actuators/ma.description: Maximum allowable altitude for this airplane to maintain the requested cabin altitude.

sim/cockpit2/pressurization/actuators/ai.description: Electrical air conditioning compressor on, consuming all the amps of rel_HVAC - not needed on airplanes with air cycle machines that drive the air conditioner off the bleed air power itself.

sim/cockpit2/pressurization/actuators/he.description: Electrical heater grid on, 0 = off, 1 = flight max (consumes rel_HVAC amps), 2 = ground max (consumes 2x rel_HVAC amps, turned off by weight-off-wheels) - not needed on airplanes that are using hot bleed air and have no heaters

sim/cockpit2/pressurization/actuators/fa.description: Electric fan (vent blower) setting, consuming 0.1 of rel_HVAVC amps when running. 0 = Auto (Runs whenever air_cond_on or heater_on is on), 1 = Low, 2 = High

sim/cockpit2/pressurization/indicators/o.description: Pressurization outflow valve ratio. 0 for fully closed, 1 for fully open. Writeable with override_pressurization

sim/cockpit2/pressurization/indicators/f.description: Electric fan speed, will be 1.0 or 2.0 depending on fan setting or 0 when there's no power or the fan is turned off. Writeable with override_pressurization

sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/engine_b.description: Engine bleed air shut off valve, close or open

sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/apu_blee.description: APU bleed air valve, close or open. APU must be running at 100%N1 to provide bleed air

sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/gpu_blee.description: GPU bleed air valve, close or open. A GPU is supposed to be always available.

sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/isol_val.description: Isolation Valve for left duct, close or open. This separates all engines on the left side of the plane, the left wing, and the left pack from the rest of the system
Isolation Valve for right duct, close or open. This separates all engines on the right side of the plane, the right wing, and the right pack from the rest of the system

sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/instrume.description: Instrument Air venturi actuated from engine bleed air, left engine
Instrument Air venturi actuated from engine bleed air, right engine

sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/pack_lef.description: Left pressurization pack, off or on. The left pack is supplied from the left side of the plane or through the left isolation valve and only available for airplanes made for 11.35 or newer

sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/pack_cen.description: Center pressurization pack, off or on. The center pack is supplied from center duct, which can be supplied from a center engine, APU, GPU, or, via the isolation valves, the left and/or right ducts. This pack is the only pack available for airplanes made for X-Plane 11.33 or older

sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/pack_rig.description: Right pressurization pack, off or on. The right pack is supplied from the right side of the plane or through the right isolation valve and only available for airplanes made for 11.35 or newer

sim/cockpit2/bleedair/indicators/bleed_a.description: Bleed air available in the left duct, which can come from left engines or through the left isolation valve. Writeable with override (override_pressurization).
Bleed air available in the center duct, which can come from a center engine, APU, GPU, or, via the isolation valves, the left and/or right ducts. Writeable with override (override_pressurization).
Bleed air available in the right duct, which can come from right engines or through the right isolation valve. Writeable with override (override_pressurization).

sim/cockpit2/bleedair/indicators/engine_.description: Bleed air being sapped from the engine, stealing efficiency from the compressor. Engine feels like induction air is this much warmer than ambient. Writeable only with override_pressurization set

sim/cockpit2/bleedair/indicators/APU_los.description: Bleed air being sapped from the APU, stealing efficiency from the compressor. Engine feels like induction air is this much warmer than ambient. Writeable only with override_pressurization set

sim/cockpit2/oxygen/actuators/demand_flo.description: 0 = off, 1 = unregulated, 2 = now/night, 3 = day/delay 5, 4 = day/delay 10, 5 = fat/face mask 1, 6 = fat/face mask 2, 7 = fat/face mask 3, 8 = fat/face mask 4

sim/cockpit2/oxygen/actuators/num_plugge.description: number of people plugged into the bottle O2 system - note that airliners usually have a chemical oxygen system, so this is for the two pilots, while the PAX a served by a chemical oxygenator

sim/cockpit2/oxygen/indicators/o2_bottle.description: liters of O2 remaining in the crew bottle. Writeable with override_oxygen_system
pressure in the O2 bottle. Writeable with override_oxygen_system

sim/cockpit2/oxygen/indicators/pilot_fel.description: pressure altitude felt by the pilot's body. Will be lower than cabin pressure altitude when on oxygen. This is what triggers the hypoxia black-out effect. Writeable with override_oxygen_system

sim/cockpit2/oxygen/indicators/pass_oxyg.description: passenger chemical oxygen generator on and supplying passengers' O2 masks. Note that the dataref to drop the masks manually is sim/operation/failures/rel_pass_o2_on
the chemical oxygen generator can still supply the passenger oxygen masks with O2 for this many minutes

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav1_power.description: Nav radio 1 off or on, 0 or 1. If NAV1 is a TACAN receiver, 0=Off, 1=Receive, 2=Transmit/Receive

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav2_power.description: Nav radio 2 off or on, 0 or 1. If NAV2 is a TACAN receiver, 0=Off, 1=Receive, 2=Transmit/Receive

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav_power.description: Nav radio N off or on, 0 or 1. Was 0-10 pre-11.10. Radios 11 and 12 are WAAS/EGNOS receivers

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/com1_power.description: Com radio 1 off or on, 0 or 1.

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/com2_power.description: Com radio 2 off or on, 0 or 1.

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/adf1_power.description: ADF radio 1 off or on, 0 = off, 1 = antenna, 2 = on, 3 = tone, 4 = test

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/adf2_power.description: ADF radio 2 off or on, 0 = off, 1 = antenna, 2 = on, 3 = tone, 4 = test

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/dme_power.description: DME radio 1 off or on, 0 or 1.

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav1_frequ.description: Nav radio 1 frequency, Mhz component only
Nav radio 1 frequency, khz component only

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav2_frequ.description: Nav radio 2 frequency, Mhz component only
Nav radio 2 frequency, khz component only

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav_freque.description: Nav radio N frequency, Mhz component only
Nav radio N frequency, khz component only

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/tac1_chann.description: TACAN radio 1 channel 1..126 or 0 if VOR radio.

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/tac1_mode.description: TACAN radio 1 mode. ASCII 'X', 'Y' or 0 if VOR radio.

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/tac2_chann.description: TACAN radio 2 channel 1..126 or 0 if VOR radio.

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/tac2_mode.description: TACAN radio 2 mode. ASCII 'X', 'Y' or 0 if VOR radio.

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/tac_channe.description: TACAN radio N channel 1..126 or 0 if VOR radio

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/tac_mode.description: TACAN radio N mode. ASCII 'X', 'Y' or 0 if VOR radio.

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav_receiv.description: Nav receiver N should not tune paired UHF frequency to pick up a glideslope. If this is on, the receiver will only pick up localizers, but not glideslopes

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav_dme_ho.description: Nav radio N in DME hold, stops slaving DME frequency to NAV frequency

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav_dme_fr.description: DME radio N frequency, Mhz component only
DME radio N frequency, khz component only

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/com1_frequ.description: Com radio 1 frequency, Mhz component only
Com radio 1 frequency, khz component only
Com radio 1 frequency, hz, supports 8.3 khz spacing

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/com2_frequ.description: Com radio 2 frequency, Mhz component only
Com radio 2 frequency, khz component only
Com radio 2 frequency, hz, supports 8.3 khz spacing

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav1_stand.description: Standby Nav radio 1 frequency, Mhz component only
Standby Nav radio 1 frequency, khz component only

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav2_stand.description: Standby Nav radio 2 frequency, Mhz component only
Standby Nav radio 2 frequency, khz component only

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav_standb.description: Nav radio N standby frequency, hz
Standby Nav radio N frequency, Mhz component only
Standby Nav radio N frequency, khz component only

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/com1_stand.description: Standby Com radio 1 frequency, Mhz component only
Standby Com radio 1 frequency, khz component only
Com radio 1 standby frequency, hz, supports 8.3 khz spacing

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/com2_stand.description: Standby Com radio 2 frequency, Mhz component only

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav1_obs_d.description: OBS 1 (pilot side) selection, in degrees magnetic.

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav2_obs_d.description: OBS 2 (pilot isde) selection, in degrees magnetic.

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav2_cours.description: Selected course based on nav2, pilot, degrees magnetic.  This is OBS for VORs, or localizer heading for ILS

HSI source to display: 0 for Nav1, 1 for Nav2, 2 for GPS1, 3 for GPS2.

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/HSI_previe.description: Nav preview source to display: 0 for Nav1, 1 for Nav2, 2 for GPS1, 3 for GPS2.
Nav preview source to display: 0 for Nav1, 1 for Nav2, 2 for GPS1, 3 for GPS2.

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/RMI_left_u.description: RMI is taking ADF (1) or VOR (0).

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/DME_mode.description: DME display mode, where 0 is remote, 1 is frequency, and 2 is groundspeed-time.

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/DME_slave_.description: DME display selection of what NAV radio to display. 0 for Nav1, 1for Nav2.

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/nav_com_ad.description: Frequency-to-change selection for the all-in-one radio, 0->5 are Nav1, Nav2, Com1, Com2, ADF1, ADF2.

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/flight_id.description: Flight ID, as transmitted in Mode-S. Up to 7 characters, like N844X or KLM511. This is NOT the Mode-S hexcode!

sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/transponde.description: Transponder mode (off=0, stdby=1, on (mode A)=2, alt (mode C)=3, test=4, GND (mode S)=5, ta_only (mode S)=6, ta/ra=7)

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/over_midd.description: Over the marker, 0 or 1.  This stays on when over the marker

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/inner_mar.description: Received signal strength of the marker. 0 when not receiving, 1 when at max strength

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/outer_mar.description: Marker light actually lit, 0 or 1. This flashes as we go over.

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/inner_mar.description: Marker light actually lit, 0 or 1. This flashes as we go over.
