sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/fms_exec_.description: Is the exec FMS light/warning lit for the pilot
Is the exec FMS light/warning lit for the co-pilot

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/fms_dista.description: FMS Distance to Top of Descent

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/fms_tod_b.description: Index of waypoint in flightplan before which top of descent is located
Distance from top of descent to Nth waypoint (wayoint found via fms_tod_before_index_pilot)

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/ian_mode.description: Integrated Approach Navigation. Which signal is overriden: 0=None, 1=Glide path only, 2=Final Approach Course and Glide Path

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/fas_id.description: Final Approach Segment ID, such as "IFNW", "W05A", "G25A", "RNV23LY" depending on type of approach being flown

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/ltp_id.description: Landing Threshold Point ID, or "DME" in case of ILS approach

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/ltp_dist_.description: Distance to Landing Threshold Point or ILS-DME.

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/fas_has_d.description: Distance readout to Landing Treshold Point is active (or ILS is tuned and DME is received)

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/fas_id_co.description: Copilot FMS: Final Approach Segment ID, such as "IFNW", "W05A", "G25A", "RNV23LY" depending on type of approach being flown

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/ltp_id_co.description: Copilot FMS: Landing Threshold Point ID, or "DME" in case of ILS approach

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/ltp_dist_.description: Copilot FMS: Distance to Landing Threshold Point or ILS-DME.

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/fas_has_d.description: Copilot FMS: Distance readout to Landing Treshold Point is active (or ILS is tuned and DME is received)

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/landing_a.description: Barometric altitude (MSL) of the selected takeoff or landing runway.
Copilot FMS: Barometric altitude (MSL) of the selected takeoff or landing runway.

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/HAT_pilot.description: Height above threshold: Barometric height difference between landing threshold and current altitude. This is not equal to radio altimeter! Radio altimeter sees hills before the airport, this doesn't!

sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/HAT_copil.description: Copilot FMS: Height above threshold: Barometric height difference between landing threshold and current altitude. This is not equal to radio altimeter! Radio altimeter sees hills before the airport, this doesn't!

sim/cockpit2/switches/gnd_com_power_on.description: Switch, 0 or 1. This is to turn COM1 on to get a clearance without turning the rest of the avionics on.

sim/cockpit2/switches/landing_lights_on.description: Switch, 0 or 1.  This affects the first landing light.

sim/cockpit2/switches/landing_lights_swi.description: Switch, 0 is off, 0.5 is half-intensity, etc. for any of the landing lights.

sim/cockpit2/switches/generic_lights_swi.description: Switch, 0 is off, 0.5 is half-intensity, etc. for any of the generic lights.  Was [64] until 11.10

sim/cockpit2/switches/jet_sync_mode.description: Switch, 0 or 1. fan=0, off=1, turbine=2 sync engines when RPM of spools are close

sim/cockpit2/switches/door_open.description: Switch, 0 or 1. 0 is closed, 1 is open

sim/cockpit2/switches/dump_water.description: This will be set to true when water is in the process of dumping out of a water-bomber.

sim/cockpit2/switches/auto_brake_level.description: Switch, 0 is RTO (Rejected Take-Off), 1 is off, 2->5 are increasing auto-brake levels.

sim/cockpit2/switches/rotor_brake.description: Switch, 0 or 1 - turns on the rotor brake.

sim/cockpit2/switches/hotel_mode.description: Switch, 0 or 1 - turns on hotel mode on free turbines.

sim/cockpit2/switches/rotor_brake_ratio.description: Relative strength of the rotor brake compared to X-Plane default.

sim/cockpit2/switches/hotel_mode_ratio.description: Relative strength of the hotel mode brake compared to X-Plane default.

sim/cockpit2/switches/clutch_ratio.description: Current clutch ratio, 0.0 is off, 1.0 is on - follows clutch engage with some lag.

sim/cockpit2/switches/rocket_mode.description: This will have an enumeration based on the direction of fire of any maneuvering rockets.

sim/cockpit2/switches/burner_level.description: This can be 0 (half-power afterburners) or 1 (full-power burner).

sim/cockpit2/switches/alternate_static_a.description: Alternate static air ratio, 0.0 is off, 1,.0 is on.

sim/cockpit2/switches/rain_repellent_swi.description: Rain repellent other than wipers. Blower, bleed air, chemicals, etc.

sim/cockpit2/switches/custom_slider_on.description: custom sliders.  When flipped, slider moves based on timing in planemaker.

sim/cockpit2/switches/panel_brightness_r.description: Rheostat controlling panel brightness.  0 = flood, 1-3 = spot lights.

sim/cockpit2/switches/instrument_brightn.description: Rheostat controlling instruments brightnesss.  0 = default pilot, 1 = default copilot, 2-15 = custom - was [16] until 11.10

sim/cockpit2/tcas/indicators/relative_be.description: Relative bearing of each other plane in degrees for TCAS - relative to sim/flightmodel/position/true_psi not ground track or anything else

sim/cockpit2/tcas/indicators/relative_di.description: Distance to each other plane in meters for TCAS

sim/cockpit2/tcas/indicators/relative_al.description: Relative altitude (positive means above us) for TCAS

sim/cockpit2/tcas/indicators/tcas_alert.description: True if a TCAS alert is currently issued.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/indicators/tcas_num_ac.description: If TCAS is not overriden by plgugin, returns the number of planes in X-Plane, which might be under plugin control or X-Plane control. If TCAS is overriden, returns how many targets are actually being written to with the override. These are not necessarily consecutive entries in the TCAS arrays.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/modeS_id.description: 24bit (0-16777215 or 0 - 0xFFFFFF) unique ID of the airframe. This is also known as the ADS-B "hexcode".

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/modeC_code.description: Mode C transponder code 0000 to 7777. This is not really an integer, this is an octal number.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/flight_id.description: 7 character Flight ID, terminated by 0 byte. ICAO flightplan item 7.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/icao_type.description: 7 character ICAO code, terminated by 0 byte. C172, B738, etc... see https://www.icao.int/publications/DOC8643/Pages/Search.aspx

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/ssr_mode.description: 0 = Transponder Standby, 1 = mode A, 2 = mode C, 3 = mode S with TA/RA

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/x.description: local X coordinate, meter. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/y.description: local Y coordinate, meter. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/z.description: local Z coordinate, meter. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/vx.description: local X velocity. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/vy.description: local Y velocity. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/vz.description: local Z velocity. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/verti.description: absolute vertical speed feet per minute. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/hpath.description: ground track in true degrees. Derived from velocity vector.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/vpath.description: flight path angle in degrees. Derived from velocity vector.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/V_msc.description: total true speed, norm of local velocity vector. That means it includes vertical speed!

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/psi.description: true heading orientation. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/the.description: pitch angle. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/phi.description: bank angle. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/weigh.description: ground/flight logic. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/wake/wing_span.description: wing span of the aircraft creating wake turbulence

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/wake/wing_area.description: wing area (total area of both wings combined) of the aircraft creating wake turbulence

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/wake/wake_cat.description: wake category of the aircraft. This is for information purposes only and is not used to calculate the actual strength of the turbulence. 0 = Light, 1 = Medium, 2 = Heavy, 3 = Super

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/wake/mass_kg.description: actual mass of the aircraft creating the wake

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/wake/aoa.description: angle of attack of the wing creating the wake

sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/wake/lift_N.description: instantaneous lift force of the whole wing generated right now, in Newtons

sim/cockpit2/temperature/outside_air_tem.description: outside air temperature, pilot selects units

sim/cockpit2/temperature/outside_air_LE_.description: outside air temperature with leading edge, pilot selects units
outside air temperature with leading edge, celsius
outside air temperature with leading edge, fahrenheit

sim/cockpit2/temperature/outside_air_tem.description: 1 if thermo is metric, 0 if fahrenheit.

sim/cockpit2/transmissions/indicators/oi.description: Transmission oil temperature.  Units are the same as the max oil temperature in ACF file.
Transmission oil pressure.  Units are the same as the max oil pressure in ACF file.

sim/cockpit2/weapons/weapon_select_conso.description: (V10 style!) Weapon index selected on the weapon console.

sim/cockpit2/weapons/fire_rate.description: Weapon fire-rate, 0, 1, 2, 3 depending on fire rate.

sim/cockpit2/weapons/weapon_selected.description: Switch position for each weapon-arming switch (there can be several). These are the rotaries that can be dialed up or down to select various systems.

sim/cockpit2/weapons/gun_offset_heading_.description: Heading offset of the gun from within its maximum heading range

sim/cockpit2/weapons/gun_offset_pitch_ra.description: Pitch offset of the gun from within its maximum pitch range

sim/cockpit2/weapons/master_arm.description: Master arm for weapons - enables every all weapons except defensive chaff/flare

sim/cockpit2/weapons/AA_heat_missile_arm.description: Indicates if there is currently an AA Missile with a heat-seeker armed

sim/cockpit2/weapons/AA_heat_missile_has.description: Indicates whether the currently selected AA Missile (with heat-seeker) has a lock on a target

sim/cockpit2/weapons/AA_heat_missile_trg.description: Indicates the degree offset the currently selected AA Missile's (with heat-seeker) sensor is from the target.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/airbus_law.description: 0=Normal, 1=Alternate, 2=Direct, only updated if acf is equipped with Airbus flight controls.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/airbus_speed_w.description: Low-speed condition, 5 degrees below alpha-max, only updated if acf is equipped with Airbus flight controls.
Low-speed condition, 5 degrees below alpha-max, only updated if acf is equipped with Airbus flight controls.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/pitch_ratio.description: How much the flight controls are deflected in pitch after any stability augmentation, in ratio, where -1.0 is full down, and 1.0 is full up.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/roll_ratio.description: How much the flight controls are deflected in roll after any stability augmentation, in ratio, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/heading_ratio.description: How much the flight controls are deflected in heading after any stability augmentation, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/pitch_ratio_ri.description: Right wings only: This is how much the flight controls are deflected in pitch after any stability augmentation, in ratio, where -1.0 is full down, and 1.0 is full up.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/roll_ratio_rig.description: Right wings only: This is how much the flight controls are deflected in roll after any stability augmentation, in ratio, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/speedbrake_rat.description: How much the speedbrakes surfaces are extended, in ratio, where 0.0 is fully retracted, and 1.0 is fully extended.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/wingsweep_rati.description: Actual sweep, in ratio. 0.0 is no sweep deployment, 1 is max sweep deployment.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/thrust_vector_.description: Actual thrust vector, in ratio. 0.0 is no thrust vector deployment, 1 is max thrust vector deployment.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/dihedral_ratio.description: Actual dihedral, in ratio. 0.0 is no dihedral deployment, 1 is max dihedral deployment.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/incidence_rati.description: Actual incidence, in ratio. 0.0 is no incidence deployment, 1 is max incidence deployment.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/wing_retractio.description: Actual wing-retraction, in ratio. 0.0 is no wing-retraction deployment, 1 is max wing-retraction deployment.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/slat1_deploy_r.description: Slat deployment, where 0.0 is slats fully retracted, 1.0 is slats fully extended. This variable applies to lading-edge flaps as well.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/slat2_deploy_r.description: Slat deployment, where 0.0 is slats fully retracted, 1.0 is slats fully extended. This variable applies to lading-edge flaps as well.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/flap1_deploy_r.description: ACTUAL FLAP deployment for flap-set #1, in ratio, where 0.0 is flaps fully retracted, and 1.0 is flaps fully extended.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/flap2_deploy_r.description: ACTUAL FLAP deployment for flap-set #2, in ratio, where 0.0 is flaps fully retracted, and 1.0 is flaps fully extended.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/stabilizer_def.description: actual stabilizer deflection with trim for all-moving horizontal stabilizers. This is the deflection you can see visually on airliners. This is in degrees, positive for leading-edge nose up.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/aileron_trim.description: Aileron trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the aileron trim is deflected enough to move the ailerons through 30% of their travel, then that is an aileron trim of 0.3.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/elevator_trim.description: Elevator trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the elevator trim is deflected enough to move the elevators through 30% of their travel, then that is an elevator trim of 0.3.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/rudder_trim.description: Rudder trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the rudder trim is deflected enough to move the rudders through 30% of their travel, then that is an rudder trim of 0.3.

sim/flightmodel2/controls/water_rudder_d.description: Deployment of the water rudder, 0 is none, 1 is max
Angle of deflection of the physical water rudders (for animating seaplane models))

sim/flightmodel2/engines/location_x_mtr.description: Engine location, meters x, y, z, with respect to the default center of gravity.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/location_y_mtr.description: Engine location, meters x, y, z, with respect to the default center of gravity.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/location_z_mtr.description: Engine location, meters x, y, z, with respect to the default center of gravity.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/throttle_used_r.description: Throttle that is actually going to the engine, which could be different than the commanded throttle due to FADEC throttle adjustments.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/has_fuel_flow_b.description: Engine has fuel making to the mixture control, yes or no.  Writable if override_fuel_system is true.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/has_fuel_flow_a.description: Engine has fuel making to the combustion process, yes or no.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/engine_is_burni.description: Engine is currently burning fuel, yes or no.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/engine_fuel_in_.description: How much fuel has been primed into the intake port (fuel-injected engine) 0..1

sim/flightmodel2/engines/engine_rotation.description: Rotational speed of the engine crank shaft, in radians per second.
Angle of the engine crank shaft as it turns over, running 0 to 360 over and over again in normal operation. Engine speed can be different than prop rotation speed in clutched designs.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_rotation_s.description: Radians per second rotation speed of the prop.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_rotation_a.description: Angle of the prop or engine-fan as it rotates. You will see this value circulate 0 to 360 degrees over and over as the engine runs and the prop or fan turns.  If the prop looks like a blurry disc, this is how fast the blurry disc is "spinning".  "Override witih /prop_disc/override per engine!

sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_no_disc_ro.description: Angle of the prop or engine-fan as it rotates. You will see this value circulate 0 to 360 degrees over and over as the engine runs and the prop or fan turns. This dataref NEVER shows the speed of the prop disc if it happens to be showing.  You can override this to modify rendering. Override witih /prop_disc/override per engine!

sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_pitch_deg.description: ACTUAL pitch of the prop in degrees from its flat-pitch setting.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_cone_angle.description: Coning angle of the disc, in radians. Typically close to 0.0.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_angle_deg.description: Angle of the prop or engine-fan as it rotates.  This is the physical value for simulating the aircraft and is part of the engine flight modeling, and is not used to customize rendering. Writable in v12

sim/flightmodel2/engines/thrust_reverser.description: How far the reverser doors/mechanism have traveled.  0 = fully stowed, 1.0 = fully deployed.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/N1_FADEC.description: Target N1 the fadec is limiting to

sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_is_disc.description: Is the prop a disc now?  Override with /prop_disc/override per engine!

sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_tip_deflec.description: Degrees of deflection of a line from the crank shaft to the prop tip.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/fuel_pump_spinn.description: Is the electric fuel pump for this engine spinning?  1 = yes, 0 = no.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/starter_is_runn.description: Is this starter running at all

sim/flightmodel2/engines/starter_making_.description: Is this starter applying torque to the engine

sim/flightmodel2/engines/is_on_fire.description: Engine fire, 0 means none, 1 means max.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/side_sign.description: Sign of the side of the ACF for this engine: -1 for left side, 0 for inline, 1 for right side

sim/flightmodel2/engines/N1_percent.description: N1 speed as percent of max (per engine)

sim/flightmodel2/engines/N2_percent.description: N2 speed as percent of max (per engine)

sim/flightmodel2/engines/jetwash_mtr_sec.description: Speed of jetwash behind the engine exhaust in meters/second

sim/flightmodel2/engines/propwash_mtr_se.description: Speed of propwash behind the prop disc in meters/second

sim/flightmodel2/engines/rotor_blade_alp.description: Blade alpha is the dynamic-pressure-weighted average of all element angles of attack of the rotor blades. Expect blade slap as these numbers approach stall, if the disc angle of attack is near zero, so the vortices are not being cleared form the disc.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/rotor_disc_alph.description: Disc alpha is the anlge of attack of the rotor disc, after adding the influence of downwash through the disc. When this angle of attack is near zero, vortices from one blade will indeed interact with the next blade coming, since  air is not being cleared out of the disc in the vertical axis!

sim/flightmodel2/engines/rotor_blade_sla.description: Disc slap is the audio slappping sound that happens when the blades of a rotor encounter the tip vortices of the blade in front of them. This happens when the rotor blades are at a high angle of attack, shedding large vortices, and the disc as at a low angle of attack, causing those vortices to not clear the disc vertically.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/engn_exhaust_sp.description: speed of exhaust velocity out of engine nozel relative to aircraft frame of reference

sim/flightmodel2/engines/nozzle_speed_ms.description: speed of exhaust velocity out of engine nozel relative to aircraft frame of reference

sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/overr.description: Set to 1 to control the prop disc from a plugin.  Overrides all other variables in this section.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/disc_.description: If larger than zero, the prop disc is actually two discs, with this separation at the root and no separation at the tip.
Ratio to scale the length of the side image.  1.0 = the real length of the prop.
Offset from left (in "slots") for the prop disc texture.  Fractions blend horizontal images.
Offset from bottom (in "slots") for the prop disc texture
Number of horizontal slots for the prop disc in the prop disc texture
Number of vertical slots for the prop disc in the prop disc texture
Alpha of prop disc when viewed from front.  X-Plane interpolates as the view angle moves.
Alpha of prop disc when viewed of side.
Ratio to multiply disc alpha when view is inside the airplane.

sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/side_.description: Width of prop side image in meters.  Height comes from prop radius.
Ratio to scale the length of the side image.  1.0 = the real length of the prop.
Rotation angle of the side images now - allows side to rotate independently of disc, perhaps faster.
Number of side blades to draw.  Should be at least 2!
If true, prop side angle comes from billboarding logic - if false, it comes from side_angle dataref.
Offset from left (in "slots") for the prop disc texture.  Fractions blend horizontal images.
Offset from bottom (in "slots") for the prop disc texture
Number of horizontal slots for the prop side in the prop disc texture
Number of vertical slots for the prop side in the prop disc texture
Alpha of prop side when viewed from front.  X-Plane interpolates as the view angle moves.
Alpha of prop side when viewed of side.
Ratio to multiply side alpha when view is inside the airplane.
A ratio to multiply side alpha when the rotor is extending toward the camera.

sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_steer_command.description: Steering command being sent to this gear, degrees positive right.  This takes into account steering algorithms for big planes like 747, but does not free castoring and springiness.  Writable in 1030.  Override via override_wheel_steer

sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_steer_actual_.description: Steering command actually enacted by the gear, degrees positive right.  Writable in 1030.  Override via override_wheel_steer

sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_vertical_defl.description: Vertical deflection of this gear, meters.

sim/flightmodel2/gear/strut_vertical_def.description: Vertical deflection of this gear, not including tire deformation, meters.

sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_vertical_forc.description: Vertical force on this gear, newtons.

sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_rotation_spee.description: Rotational speed of this tire, radians per second.

sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_rotation_angl.description: Tire rotation in degrees, running 0 to 360 over and over as it rolls.

sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_part_brake.description: Final total braking on this gear's tires, adding up all control inputs and sources.

sim/flightmodel2/gear/deploy_ratio.description: How far down the landing gear is.  0=up, 1= down

sim/flightmodel2/gear/brake_absorbed_rat.description: How much energy has been absorbed by this brake, affects brake fading.

sim/flightmodel2/gear/eagle_claw_angle_d.description: Angle of eagle-claw landing gear now, degrees, per gear.

sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_skid_ratio.description: Ratio of how much this tire is in a skid - 0 = full traction, 1 = completely skidding

sim/flightmodel2/gear/total_deflection_r.description: Rate at which the tires are deflecting, positive means shocks are contracting

sim/flightmodel2/gear/on_ground.description: Is this wheel on the ground

sim/flightmodel2/gear/on_noisy.description: Is this wheel on some kind of noisy surface like gravel

sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_skid_speed_mt.description: How fast the skidding part of the tire is dragged across the surface it is skidding on in meters/second.

sim/flightmodel2/lights/landing_lights_b.description: Ratio of the brightness of the landing lights, 0 is off, 1 is max.

sim/flightmodel2/lights/generic_lights_b.description: Ratio of the brightness of the landing lights, 0 is off, 1 is max.  Was dim [64] until 11.10

sim/flightmodel2/lights/taxi_lights_brig.description: Ratio of the brightness of the taxi light, 0 is off, 1 is max.

sim/flightmodel2/lights/spot_lights_brig.description: Ratio of the brightness of the spot light, 0 is off, 1 is max.

sim/flightmodel2/lights/nav_lights_brigh.description: Ratio of the brightness of the nav lights, 0 is off, 1 is max.

sim/flightmodel2/lights/beacon_brightnes.description: Ratio of the brightness of the beacon, 0 is off, 1 is max.  Use override_beacons_and_strobes

sim/flightmodel2/lights/strobe_brightnes.description: Ratio of the brightness of the strobe, 0 is off, 1 is max.  Use override_beacons_and_strobes

sim/flightmodel2/lights/spot_light_headi.description: Heading offset in degrees of the spot light from its default position, positive is right.

sim/flightmodel2/lights/spot_light_pitch.description: Pitch offset in degrees of the spot light from its default position, positive is up.

sim/flightmodel2/lights/strobe_flash_now.description: Is any strobe flashing right now?

sim/flightmodel2/misc/door_open_ratio.description: How open is the door, 0 = closed, 1 = open

sim/flightmodel2/misc/door_cycle_time.description: How long it takes to open or close the door, in seconds

sim/flightmodel2/misc/water_drop_deploy_.description: Water drop door position: 0 = up, 1=  down

sim/flightmodel2/misc/wiper_angle_deg.description: current angle of the wiper.  range of motion is set in PlaneMaker.

sim/flightmodel2/misc/rain_repellent_rat.description: Rain repellent other than wipers. Blower, bleed air, chemicals, etc.

sim/flightmodel2/misc/custom_slider_rati.description: Misc. traveling items for your use.  You define the meaning.

sim/flightmodel2/misc/pressure_outflow_r.description: How far is the pressure-outflow valve open?  0=closed, 1=open

sim/flightmodel2/misc/AoA_angle_degrees.description: Angle of attack probe.  Positive means aircracft nose is above the flight path in aircraft coordinates.

sim/flightmodel2/misc/bouncer_x.description: lateral offset in meters from default for this bouncer

sim/flightmodel2/misc/bouncer_y.description: vertical offset in meters from default for this bouncer

sim/flightmodel2/misc/bouncer_z.description: longitudinal offset in meters from default for this bouncer

sim/flightmodel2/misc/bouncer_vx.description: lateral offset in meters from default for this bouncer

sim/flightmodel2/misc/bouncer_vy.description: vertical offset in meters from default for this bouncer

sim/flightmodel2/misc/bouncer_vz.description: longitudinal offset in meters from default for this bouncer

sim/flightmodel2/misc/auto_start_in_prog.description: True while the auto-start sequence is happening.  Plugins that override the auto-start sequence should set this to 1 during the sequence and clear it when done.

sim/flightmodel2/misc/auto_board_in_prog.description: True while the auto-board sequence is happening.  Plugins that override the auto-board sequence should set this to 1 during the sequence and clear it when done.

sim/flightmodel2/misc/tow_in_progress.description: True while a tow operation is currently taking place.

sim/flightmodel2/misc/has_crashed.description: True if the aircraft is in a crashed state

sim/flightmodel2/misc/cg_offset_z.description: Longitudinal Center of Gravity, including payload, and including internal and external fuel

sim/flightmodel2/misc/cg_offset_x.description: Lateral Center of Gravity (can't be set on all craft, only on such with weight stations off the centerline) including payload and including internal or external fuel or weapons

sim/flightmodel2/misc/cg_offset_z_mac.description: Longitudinal Center of Gravity, including payload, internal and external fuel and weapons, measured in % mean aerodynamic chord of the wings (Wings 1-4 in Plane Maker numbering).

sim/flightmodel2/misc/zfw_cg_offset_z.description: Longitudinal Center of Gravity of the zero fuel weight. This is including payload, but excluding internal and external fuel and external weapons. Read-only (use individual payload station weight to change it)

sim/flightmodel2/misc/zfw_cg_offset_x.description: Lateral Center of Gravity of the zero fuel weight. This is including payload (such as pilots in a helicopter), but excluding internal and external fuel and external weapons. Read-only (use individual payload station weight to change it)

sim/flightmodel2/position/true_theta.description: The pitch of the aircraft relative to the earth precisely below the aircraft

sim/flightmodel2/position/true_phi.description: The roll of the aircraft relative to the earth precisely below the aircraft

sim/flightmodel2/position/true_psi.description: The heading of the aircraft relative to the earth precisely below the aircraft - true degrees north, always

sim/flightmodel2/position/mag_psi.description: The real magnetic heading of the aircraft - the old magpsi dataref was FUBAR

sim/flightmodel2/position/alpha.description: The pitch relative to the flown path (angle of attack)

sim/flightmodel2/position/beta.description: The heading relative to the flown path (yaw)

sim/flightmodel2/position/vpath.description: The pitch the aircraft actually flies.  (vpath+alpha=theta)

sim/flightmodel2/position/hpath.description: The heading the aircraft actually flies.  (hpath+beta=psi)

sim/flightmodel2/position/groundspeed.description: The ground speed of the aircraft

sim/flightmodel2/position/true_airspeed.description: Air speed true - this does not take into account air density at altitude!

sim/flightmodel2/position/ecef_x.description: The location of the user aircraft in ECEF coordinates, using a WGS84 geoid.

sim/flightmodel2/position/ecef_y.description: The location of the user aircraft in ECEF coordinates, using a WGS84 geoid.

sim/flightmodel2/position/ecef_z.description: The location of the user aircraft in ECEF coordinates, using a WGS84 geoid.

sim/flightmodel2/position/ellipsoid_heig.description: User airplane altitude as ellipsoid height over WGS84

sim/flightmodel2/position/pressure_altit.description: User airplane altitude as pressure altitude in standard atmosphere

sim/flightmodel2/wing/aileron1_deg.description: Deflection of the aileron from set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.

sim/flightmodel2/wing/aileron2_deg.description: Deflection of the aileron from set #2 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.

sim/flightmodel2/wing/spoiler1_deg.description: Deflection of the roll-spoilerfrom set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.

sim/flightmodel2/wing/spoiler2_deg.description: Deflection of the roll-spoilerfrom set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.

sim/flightmodel2/wing/yawbrake_deg.description: Deflection of the yaw-brake on this wing. A yaw-brake is a set of spoilers on the top and bottom of the wing that split open symmetrically to drag that wing aft and yaw the plane. They are used on the B-2, for example.

sim/flightmodel2/wing/elevator1_deg.description: Deflection of the elevator from set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.

sim/flightmodel2/wing/elevator2_deg.description: Deflection of the elevator from set #2 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.

sim/flightmodel2/wing/rudder1_deg.description: Deflection of the rudder from set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge right.

sim/flightmodel2/wing/rudder2_deg.description: Deflection of the rudder from set #2 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge right.

sim/flightmodel2/wing/flap1_deg.description: Deflection of the flap from set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.

sim/flightmodel2/wing/flap2_deg.description: Deflection of the flap from set #2 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.

sim/flightmodel2/wing/speedbrake1_deg.description: Deflection of the speedbrakes from set #1 on this wing.

sim/flightmodel2/wing/speedbrake2_deg.description: Deflection of the speedbrakes from set #2 on this wing.

sim/flightmodel2/wing/wing_tip_deflectio.description: Degrees of deflection of a line from the wing root (extended to the plane centerline) to the tip.

sim/flightmodel2/wing/wing_condensation_.description: Strength of wing condensation for this wing, 0 is none, 1 = max

sim/flightmodel2/wing/wing_tip_condensat.description: Strength of wing tip vapor trail for this wing, 0 is none, 1 = max

sim/flightmodel2/wing/elements/element_M.description: Width of chord at the MAC.

sim/flightmodel2/wing/elements/element_i.description: Per element - is this element stalled?

sim/graphics/VR/button_axis_x.description: For OBJs used to draw VR controllers: the X deflection (or axis deflection) of each axis on the controller.

sim/graphics/VR/button_axis_y.description: For OBJs used to draw VR controllers: for 2-d thumb sticks or dpads, this is the second axis.

sim/graphics/VR/button_down.description: For OBJs used to draw VR controllers: button status of each button on the controller.

sim/graphics/VR/backlight_level.description: For OBJs used to draw VR controllers: Level of back lighting on the controller.

sim/graphics/VR/seeker_light_level.description: For OBJs used to draw VR controllers: Level of lighting on the tip of the controller.

sim/graphics/VR/touch_spot_light_level.description: For OBJs used to draw VR controllers: Level of lighting on the D-Pad/joystick part of the controller.

sim/graphics/VR/enabled.description: True if VR is enabled, false if it is disabled

sim/graphics/VR/using_3d_mouse.description: True if the 3-d VR mouse is in use

sim/graphics/VR/teleport_on_ground.description: True if the user is teleporting outside the aircraft.  In this case the pilot's head position is not reliable - use the regular camera location
